009package Ch03_PointOperations;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.Blitter;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * This plugin demonstrates linear (alpha) blending between two images:
021 * <br>
022 * {@code imBG}: the background image (the current active image),
023 * <br>
024 * {@code imFG}: the foreground image (selected in a user dialog).
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * Both images must be open when the plugin is started. The images 
028 * may be of different size.
029 * The transparency of the foreground image is initially set to &alpha; = 0.5
030 * but may be adjusted in the user dialog.
031 * See Sec. 3.8.5 (Prog. 3.5) of [1] for additional details.
032 * </p>
033 * <p>
034 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>,
035 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
036 * </p>
037 * @author WB
038 * @version 2022/04/01
039 */
040public class Linear_Blending implements PlugInFilter {
041        
042        private static double alpha = 0.5;      // transparency of foreground image
043        private ImagePlus imFG = null;          // foreground image (to be selected)
044        
045        @Override
046        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imBG) {
047                return DOES_8G;
048        }       
049        
050        @Override
051        public void run(ImageProcessor ipBG) {  // ipBG = background image
052                if(!runDialog() || imFG == null) {
053                        return;
054                }
055                ImageProcessor ipFG = imFG.getProcessor().convertToByte(false);
056                ipFG = ipFG.duplicate();
057                ipFG.multiply(1 - alpha);
058                ipBG.multiply(alpha);
059                ipBG.copyBits(ipFG, 0, 0, Blitter.ADD);
060        }       
061
062        private boolean runDialog() {
063                // get list of open images and their titles:
064                ImagePlus[] images = IjUtils.getOpenImages(true);
065                String[] titles = new String[images.length];
066                for (int i = 0; i < images.length; i++) {
067                        titles[i] = images[i].getShortTitle();
068                }
069                // create the dialog and show:
070                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
071                gd.addChoice("Foreground image:", titles, titles[0]);
072                gd.addNumericField("Alpha value (0,..,1)", alpha, 2);   
073                gd.showDialog();
074                
075                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
076                        return false;
077                }
078
079                imFG = images[gd.getNextChoiceIndex()];
080                alpha = gd.getNextNumber();
081                return true;
082        }
083}
